When people ask me why we talk about the weight of our HomeChoice blankets, the reason is that the weight of a blanket suggests how warm it is by giving an indication of how thick or dense it is. The weight of a blanket also relates to its level of comfort – but this is different for everyone. Did you know that there are actually therapeutic reasons for using a heavy blanket? Let me explain.
Explore our wide range of blankets from 2kg all the way to 7kg!
Some healthy pressure
The comfortable pressure you feel on your body when sleeping under a heavy blanket is similar to a technique occupational therapists use called ‘deep pressure stimulation’. Like a massage, it is strategically pushing, squeezing or holding the body to relieve pain or make a person calm. When done correctly, the technique reduces levels of cortisol (our main stress hormone), and releases serotonin (our happiness hormone)1.
A study using specially weighted blankets reports that the heavy weight produced “feelings of safety, relaxation and comfort” for the people who participated in the study2. Another study used weighted vests on restless children, concluding that the extra weight helped them to stay calm and focus more on their schoolwork3. Studies have even found the use of weighted blankets and vests to relieve the symptoms of anxiety and insomnia4.
The soothing effect of extra weight is ideal for helping people to fall asleep quickly. The weight also helps with tossing and turning for better quality of sleep without periods of wakefulness. There is even evidence to suggest that people with restless leg syndrome or chronic pain can find better sleep just by using the gentle pressure of a heavy blanket5.
Some healthy pressure
The comfortable pressure you feel on your body when sleeping under a heavy blanket is similar to a technique occupational therapists use called ‘deep pressure stimulation’. Like a massage, it is strategically pushing, squeezing or holding the body to relieve pain or make a person calm. When done correctly, the technique reduces levels of cortisol (our main stress hormone), and releases serotonin (our happiness hormone)1.
A study using specially weighted blankets reports that the heavy weight produced “feelings of safety, relaxation and comfort” for the people who participated in the study2. Another study used weighted vests on restless children, concluding that the extra weight helped them to stay calm and focus more on their schoolwork3. Studies have even found the use of weighted blankets and vests to relieve the symptoms of anxiety and insomnia4.
The soothing effect of extra weight is ideal for helping people to fall asleep quickly. The weight also helps with tossing and turning for better quality of sleep without periods of wakefulness. There is even evidence to suggest that people with restless leg syndrome or chronic pain can find better sleep just by using the gentle pressure of a heavy blanket5.
Sleeping safe and sound
Experts say that a heavy blanket is safe to use as long as you can move around underneath it6. For the best effect, it should be around 10% of the user’s bodyweight7. I don’t recommend heavy blankets for children under the age of 2 or for anyone who struggles with breathing issues like sleep apnea. However, if you could use some de-stressing in front of the TV or a better night’s sleep at the end of a long day, I highly recommend a heavy blanket for you!

The HomeChoice Sleep Expert
